alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blowing Dust Advisory issued April 19 at 6:00PM MDT until April 19 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, north winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust expected. * WHERE...Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 3 AM MDT Thursday. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Those who are sensitive to poor air quality will want to remain indoors through this evening. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
